name: Process to develop new feature
description:
Process to develop new feature

  1. Create new jira epic containing
    1. User journey
    2. Acceptance criteria
  2. Divide story into various stories
    1. Analysis
    2. Data model creation
    3. Backend implementation stories for each APIs identified
    4. Frontend integration for all APIs 
    5. Testing
    6. PR merge and deployment
  3. Ticket should travel journey
    1. First BA creates stories
    2. Lead does Analysis and Data model
    3. Developers work for backend and frontend implementation
    4. Lead verifies and merges changes
    5. DevOps people deploy changes in dev environment
    6. Testing team do the testing and raise bug-fix
    7. Developers fix bug and step d-g repeats till all bug fix done
    8. Changes deployed in testing, pre-prod
    9. Integration testing performed by QA team. UAT performed by end users.
    10. In case of any bug-fix, step g-j repeats.
    11. Once UAT sign-off received, changes  deployed in prod.

name: [TBD] Process to take backup
description:
Process to take backup

  1. Identify the stuff to be backed up
  2. Identify way to backup process, first manual, then semi-automated and finally automated
  3. Create script for backup
  4. Identify frequency for backup
  5. Develop one mechanism to notify future backup schedule. Also, mechanism should notify, if missed schedule.
  6. Develop one page for previous backup schedule and their status and other related details

name: [TBD] Process to publish topic
description:
Process to publish a topic:

  1. Create a topic.
  2. Initially, the topic should be in a drafted state.
  3. Once the topic is sufficiently matured with its content, it should enter the review state.
  4. As per the workflow, the topic gets reviewed.
  5. Once approved, the topic should be made available for the configured audience. One version tag should be added for future reference.
  6. If the topic needs some modification, there must be a mechanism to update the topic post-review and approval. Once successfully updated, a new tag should be associated with the topic.
